events.description: Steel rebar futures fell below CNY 3,080 a ton, hitting a one-month low.
Chinese steel mills trimmed production ahead of the holiday period.
Official data showed Chinese construction activity rebounded in December.

facts.fact_text: Steel rebar futures fell below CNY 3,080 a ton.

evidences.evidence_text: Steel rebar futures fell below CNY 3,080 a ton, hitting a one-month low
industry data showed blast furnace utilization remained above 86%, higher than the previous week

facts.fact_text: Daily hot metal output rose by 21,000 tons week-on-week.

evidences.evidence_text: daily hot metal output rose by 21,000 tons week-on-week

facts.fact_text: China's steel output totaled 960.8 Mt last year.

evidences.evidence_text: China remains the world’s largest steel producer, with output totaling 960.8 Mt. last year

facts.fact_text: India, the US, Japan, and Russia together produced 395.4 Mt of steel.

evidences.evidence_text: followed by India, the US, Japan, and Russia, which together produced 395.4 Mt.

claims.claim_text: Global steel supply will decline in 2025.
claims.author: World Steel Association

evidences.evidence_text: data from the World Steel Association pointed to a decline in global steel supply in 2025

claims.claim_text: Planned maintenance is weighing on near-term demand.

evidences.evidence_text: Several blast furnaces and electric-arc furnaces have paused operations for planned maintenance, weighing on near-term demand.

claims.claim_text: Production cuts in China are driven by an anti-involution campaign.
claims.author: World Steel Association

evidences.evidence_text: led by production cuts in China under its anti-involution campaign

evidence.evidence_text: Chinese steel mills trimmed production ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday.
led by production cuts in China under its anti-involution campaign
On the demand side, official data showed Chinese construction activity rebounded in December
Several blast furnaces and electric-arc furnaces have paused operations for planned maintenance, weighing on near-term demand.
